Class Date

  • java.lang.Object
    • Date

  • public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a year, month, day triplet.

    Jun20'14,1344h
    Author:
    James Pede

    • Constructor Detail

      • Date

        public Date()
        Constructor for objects of class Date

      • Date

        public Date(int year,
            int month,
            int day)
        Non-default constructor. Institutes a starting Y-M-D combination.
        Parameters:
        year - measured in the Gregorian Calendar, or Common Era, and validated to a min and max
        month - a whole number ranging between (the constants) JANUARY and DECEMBER
        day - ranges between 1 and a varying monthly max; validated by getNumberOfDaysInThisMonth()

    • Method Detail

      • getDay

        public int getDay()
        Accessor.
        Returns:
        day attribute

      • getDayOfTheWeek

        public java.lang.String getDayOfTheWeek()
        Working only from the data in the attributes, a day, month, and year is interpreted into one of the seven days of the week. Assumption: this.year shouldn't be lower than ERA1 or higher than ERA6's top end. The assumption isn't actually valid, when MIN_YEAR = 0, but hey, we'll roll with it.
        Returns:
        a weekday literal, e.g. "Saturday"

      • getFormattedDate

        public java.lang.String getFormattedDate()
        Translate attribute information into a YYYY-MM-DD date-String.
        Returns:
        year-padded(month)-padded(day)

      • getMonth

        public int getMonth()
        Accessor.
        Returns:
        month attribute

      • getMonthName

        public static java.lang.String getMonthName(int monthNumber)
        Convert a month index, such as 7, into the corresponding month word, such as "August".
        Parameters:
        monthNumber - a month index; validated to the range JANUARY to DECEMBER
        Returns:
        a literal containing the name of a month OR null, when validation fails

      • getMonthNumber

        public static int getMonthNumber(java.lang.String monthName)
        Convert a month word, such as "September", into the corresponding month index, such as 9.
        Parameters:
        monthName - a literal containing the name of a month; matched case-insensitive
        Returns:
        a month index OR the 'error index' (UNKNOWN_MONTH), when no match

      • getNumberOfDaysInThisMonth

        public int getNumberOfDaysInThisMonth()
        The number of days in a month is dependent entirely on what the month is. The sole exception to this rule is FEBRUARY, whose count goes +1 on leap years.
        Returns:
        some number between 28 and 31; used as an upper bound on this.day

      • getYear

        public int getYear()
        Accessor.
        Returns:
        year attribute

      • set

        public void set(int year,
                int month,
                int day)
        Due to the fact that a day's validity hinges on both the month and year, this common mutator was developed for all three attributes. You will find that each of the individual mutators just defer to this one, often by treating old, unchanged data as new data.
        Parameters:
        year - measured in the Gregorian Calendar, or Common Era, and validated to a min and max
        month - a whole number ranging between (the constants) JANUARY and DECEMBER
        day - ranges between 1 and a varying monthly max; validated by getNumberOfDaysInThisMonth()

      • setDay

        public void setDay(int day)
        Mutator.
        Parameters:
        day - a whole number ranging between 1 and getNumberOfDaysInThisMonth()

      • setMonth

        public void setMonth(int month)
        Mutator.
        Parameters:
        month - a whole number ranging between JANUARY and DECEMBER, inclusive

      • setYear

        public void setYear(int year)
        Mutator.
        Parameters:
        year - a whole number representing a span of ~365 days in the Gregorian Calendar
